Thanks for the help.  Between what you wrote and other information out there, I 
added this line to my bash_profile (bashrc doesn't persist between sessions for some 
reason in os x):

export CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:/Applications/Utilities/Java/junit3.8.1/junit.jar

Which let junit run, but gave me this error in the junit window:

Class not found "junit.samples.AllTests"

So I added this to my bash_profile:

export CLASSPATH=$CLASSPATH:/Applications/Utilities/Java/junit3.8.1/

and tried running the tests again with:

java junit.swingui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests

But it results in this message in the bottom box in the junit window:

Failed to invoke suite():java.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: junit/tests/runner/
BaseTestRunnerTest$MockRunner

This might not matter so much if junit will work with programs I write, but I would like 
to see the installation tests run.

--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Demyanovich, Craig - Apogent" 
<cdemyanovich@a...> wrote:
> > That's a typo.  The export command should be in
> >   $HOME/.bashrc
> >            *
> 
> Nice catch, Jim.  As an example of $HOME, the value on my machine would be
> /Users/craig.  So, the full path to .bashrc for me would be
> /Users/craig/.bashrc.  This could also be abbreviated to ~./bashrc, as '~'
> is a shortcut for the home directory of the user currently executing the
> shell.
> 
> Thanks,
> Craig
>
